Material used.Material Name: Third instar larval of Drosophila pink1 B9 null mutants and control (w pink1 REV )
Material used.Description: We measured neurotransmission using current clamp recordings at third instar larval NMJs in 2 or 0.5 mM Ca2þ in Drosophila pink1 B9 null mutants and control (w pink1 REV )

Readout description.Conclusion: No deficits in neurotransmitter release or in amplitude or frequency of the spontaneous vesicle fusion in 0.5 mM Ca2þ and TTX; significant progressive decline in synaptic transmission at 10 Hz stimulation
Readout description.Result Description: pink1 B9 null mutants did not show deficits in neurotransmitter release or in amplitude or frequency of the spontaneous vesicle fusion measured in 0.5 mM Ca2þ and TTX. However, when pink1 mutants were stimulated at a higher and more intense frequency of 10 Hz, a small but significant progressive decline in synaptic transmission was observed.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t - test was used for statistical analysis.

Material used.Material Name: Third instar larval of Drosophila pink1 B9 null mutants, control (w pink1 REV ) and pink1 mutants neuronally expressing human PINK1
Material used.Description: FM1 - 43 dye was used to label synaptic vesicles in third instar larval of Drosophila pink1 B9 null mutants, control (w pink1 REV ) and pink1 mutants neuronally expressing human PINK1

Readout description.Conclusion: ECP labelling not affected; RP labelling inefficient in pink1 B9 mutants, rescued by expressing human PINK1
Readout description.Result Description: The vesicle endocytosis and labelling of the ECP in pink1 B9 is not affected; however, the RP cannot be efficiently labelled in pink1 B9 mutants. This was rescued by expressing human PINK1 in the affected neurons.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t - test was used for statistical analysis.

Material used.Material Name: Drosophila pink1 B9 null mutants, control (w pink1 REV ), Pink1 knockout mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 - / - ) and wild - type mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 + / + )
Material used.Description: Morphometric analysis was performed on Drosophila pink1 B9 null mutants, control (w pink1 REV ), Pink1 knockout mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 - / - ) and wild - type mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 + / + )

Readout description.Conclusion: No alterations in mitochondrial morphology or synaptic localization in Drosophila and mouse - mutant cell lines
Readout description.Result Description: No alterations at pink1 B9 mutant NMJs were observed, nor did we observe a difference in synaptic mitochondrial localization. Also in fibroblasts obtained from Pink1 mouse mutants expressing mitochondrially targeted yellow fluorescent protein (YFP), no significant alterations in mitochondrial morphology were observed.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the average ± SEM of three independent experiments for mouse fibroblast cell lines

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t - test was used for statistical analysis.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Real - time imaging of mitochondrial membrane potential

Material used.Material Name: Drosophila pink1 B9 null mutants, control (w pink1 REV ), Pink1 knockout mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 - / - ) and wild - type mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 + / + )
Material used.Description: Mitochondrial membrane potential was evaluated in Drosophila pink1 B9 null mutants, control (w pink1 REV ), Pink1 knockout mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 - / - ) and wild - type mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 + / + )

Readout description.Conclusion: Decreased mitochondrial membrane potential in pink1 B9 mutants and Pink1 - / - fibroblasts
Readout description.Result Description: Synaptic mitochondria of pink1 B9 mutants showed a less red JC - 1 labelling, indicating a decreased ΔΨm. Pink1 - / - cells responded to oligomycin with a dramatic drop in ΔΨm

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the average ± SEM of eight independent experiments for fibroblast cells

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t - test was used for statistical analysis.

Material used.Material Name: Pink1 knockout mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 - / - ) and wild - type mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 + / + )
Material used.Description: Apoptosis was evaluated in Pink1 knockout mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 - / - ) and wild - type mouse fibroblasts (Pink1 + / + ) treated with H2O2 and arachidonic acid

Readout description.Conclusion: Increased sensitivity to apoptotic stimuli in Pink1 - / - fibroblasts
Readout description.Result Description: Pink1 - / - cells were more sensitive to two Ca2 + - dependent apoptotic stimuli that act through the mitochondrial pathway, the oxidant H2O2 and the lipid second messenger arachidonic acid

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the average ± SEM of three independent experiments

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t - test was used for statistical analysis.

Material used.Material Name: Mitochondria from Pink1 knockout mouse liver and brain (Pink1 - / - ), wild - type mouse liver and brain (Pink1 + / + ), Drosophila brain and thorax muscle
Material used.Description: Mitochondria were isolated from Pink1 knockout mouse liver and brain (Pink1 - / - ), wild - type mouse liver and brain (Pink1 + / + ), Drosophila brain and thorax muscle for respiratory assays

Readout description.Conclusion: Reduced Complex I activity in Pink1 - / - mitochondria
Readout description.Result Description: The ratio of ADP - stimulated (State 3) to basal (State 4) oxygen consumption rate was significantly decreased in Pink1 - / - mitochondria when energized with Complex I substrates. A strong, and specific reduction in Complex I activity in Pink1 - / - mitochondrial homogenates was confirmed by direct measurements of enzymatic activity

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the average ± SEM of three independent experiments for mouse mitochondria and at least three independent experiments for fly mitochondria

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t - test was used for statistical analysis.
